decks.notes: This deck aims to ramp up quickly with Basalt Monolith and Grim Monolith, utilizing Manifold Key and Voltaic Key to untap them for extra mana. Mystic Forge allows for card draw and potential combos with artifacts such as The One Ring and Kozilek's Command. Karn, the Great Creator enables access to artifacts in exile, like Defense Grid and Disruptor Flute. Using Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors for fast mana, alongside Urza's Tower and Urza's Workshop for additional resources, this deck seeks to establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with powerful artifacts.

This Legacy combo deck utilizes the interaction between Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the library, triggering Narcomoeba and getting them back with Dread Return to win with Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, as well as card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. Urza's Saga is used to tutor for key pieces while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides additional card draw. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can react.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then utilizing cards like Entomb and Reanimate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a quick and devastating win. The deck also includes cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to disrupt and protect the combo, while utilizing cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for key pieces. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficient reanimation of big threats while controlling the game with counterspells and disruption.

The deck is focused on assembling the Cephalid Breakfast combo, which revolves around using Cephalid Illusionist to mill cards into the graveyard and then utilizing Dread Return to reanimate a creature like Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck includes support cards like Nomads en-Kor and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to help facilitate the combo, along with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze for protection. The deck also runs efficient card filtering like Brainstorm and Ponder, along with powerful land options like Urza's Saga for additional value.

The deck focuses on creating a loop using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the library, triggering Narcomoeba and eventually winning the game with either Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck includes protection spells like Force of Will and counter spells like Daze, along with card selection through Brainstorm and Ponder. Urza's Saga helps to tutor for key combo pieces, while Teferi, Time Raveler disrupts the opponent's game plan. The mana base includes fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The main concept of this Cephalid Breakfast combo deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces of Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to mill the entire library, trigger Narcomoeba, and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares for protection, along with card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm and Ponder. Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures provide additional utility and resilience to the combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board using efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Cori-Steel Cutter while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also aims to deal direct damage with spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder helps to dig for important cards and ensure a consistent draw engine. The land base includes fetch lands and utility lands like Wasteland to support the aggressive tempo strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost and other lands, in order to consistently play powerful threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Karn, the Great Creator. This combo-oriented deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will to protect its game plan and control the opponent's strategy. By efficiently ramping up mana and having a combination of threats and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through its powerful plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the tempo of the game, while applying pressure on the opponent. By utilizing efficient removal spells such as Fatal Push and disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Daze, as well as strong creatures like Nethergoyf and Brazen Borrower, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong offensive presence. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Kaito to further control the board and provide additional card advantage. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's aggressive strategy and maximize its efficiency.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Doomsday combo to win the game. The deck includes cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to generate mana and cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for key pieces. Key cards like Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle are used to win the game once the combo is assembled. The deck also includes disruption like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and ensure it goes off successfully. The plan is to win the game swiftly and efficiently using a well-executed combo.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through the manipulation and management of lands. Utilizing cards like Life from the Loam, Crop Rotation, and Exploration, the deck aims to establish and protect powerful land combos such as Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. By disrupting opponent's strategies with cards like Mox Diamond and Pithing Needle, while also utilizing cards like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures for additional value, the deck creates a strong control game plan centered around lands.

This deck focuses on utilizing the ability of Nadu, Winged Wisdom to create infinite mana by repeatedly targeting Nomads en-Kor. This combo allows for multiple win conditions, such as casting Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath or using Green Sun's Zenith to search for key cards. The deck also includes disruption options like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, as well as card draw and selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base includes various dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent mana production for the combo to go off effectively.

This combo deck aims to generate a high storm count by casting multiple cheap spells in order to eventually cast Tendrils of Agony to drain the opponent's life total. The deck features a variety of fast mana sources like Chrome Mox, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal, as well as efficient draw and discard spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Duress to help find combo pieces and disrupt the opponent. Infernal Tutor and Beseech the Mirror serve as tutors to find key cards like Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony, while cards like Gaea's Will and Cabal Ritual help generate extra mana to fuel the storm count.
